ok good point, but what if the user is from another machine? do i create that user?
what?  You're logging in as a user...
let me give you an ex.  i have 3 users on the remote box, a,b,c  and user f on the client only, will i have to create user f on the remote box with users a,b,c ?
what?  No.  you log in to the remote box with users a/b/c anyway.  You can't login remotely with a user that doesn't exist on that box.
remote login means nothing.  All it does is redirect where input/output come from.  As far as the machine is concerned, you're logged in locally
ahh, right so that brings me to my point then that whatever perm i set locally, I can view them remotely, and also view them thru nautilus?
i think ive got what ya mean
No.  Locally stuff affects local stuff, remote stuff affects remote stuff.
i probably need to be clear on the terminology

When you log in to a machine, whether through a thinclient (or via remote X or whatever), or sitting at a machine somewhere, you log in as a particular user on that machine.  user A, B, or C, in that example.  User F doesn't exist on any box except the one you're sitting at now, itdoesn't exist at the remote box.
